title: Cordial Glass With Engraved Ornaments, "Emperor's Set", 1870
provenance: This set was originally ordered by Emperor Francis Joseph I for the opening of the Vienna Museum of Applied Arts. It was then specially shown at the Vienna World Exhibition 1873 and afterwards put on display in the working room by the Emperor in order to represent Austria's glass industries. It was copper wheel-engraved with the Habsburg crest and elaborate ornaments.
dimensions: H x diam.: 9.2 x 5.1 cm (3 5/8 x 2 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Mouth-blown crystal, facet-cut and polished (without engraving)

participants.person_name: J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria
J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria
